results.title: Alfred Hitchcock presents
results.creator_credit: Alfred J Hitchcock Productions and Shamley Productions
results.brief_description: The benign countenance of pudgy film director Alfred Hitchcock welcomed viewers to stories of terror, horror, suspense, and twisted endings for an entire decade. His clipped British accent and catlike theme music became symbols of Hitchcock’s black humour. The stories would often appear to end with evil triumphant, in strict violation of the television code of ethics. This situation was always resolved following the last commercial when Hitchcock would return to explain in his deadpan sardonic way, what silly mistake or chance occuurrence had finally done the villain in.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alfred J Hitchcock Productions and Shamley Productions

results.title: Night of the execution. Forty detectives later
results.creator_credit: Alfred J Hitchcock Productions and Shamley Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Alfred Hitchcock presents”.
Two more twisted fables hosted by the master of the macabre. “Night of the execution”: A District Attorney, keen for political success and whose wife is more ambtious than he is, is desperate for a conviction in a murder trial he is prosecuting. So desperate, he is willing to do anything to send the defendant to the chair… anything. “Forty detectives later”: A man who claims he has found his wife’s murderer, hires his forty-first detective to wreak vengeance…

results.title: The Big score. Malice domestic.
results.creator_credit: Alfred J Hitchcock Productions and Shamley Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Alfred Hitchcock presents”.
Another two macabre tales hosted by the master. “The Big score”: A deceitful baby-sitter sets up her delinquent friends for a heist of her trusting employer’s money. The evening ends in murder, but who is who in this twisted nightmare? “Malice domestic”: A writer who loves his wife’s cooking is incredulous when his doctor tries to tell him that his wife is trying to kill him. If only his dog could tell him what’s really going on.

results.title: The Door without a key. The Landlady
results.creator_credit: Alfred J Hitchcock Productions and Shamley Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Alfred Hitchcock presents”.
Two more fine tales introduced by the master of the macabre. “The Door without a key”: Uplifting tale of the comings and goings of a police-station late at night. Stars Claude Rains as a man with amnesia and Billy Mumy as a lost little boy. “The Landlady”: A young man arrives in a provincial town in England needing a place to stay. It was strange circumstance that drew the young man to stay at this boarding house, it was an even stranger circumstance that made him a permanent guest. A gentle horror story based on a Roald Dahl short story and adapted by Robert Bloch. Stars Dean Stockwell.

results.title: The Last dark step; Flight to the East
results.creator_credit: Alfred J Hitchcock Productions and Shamley Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Alfred Hitchcock presents”.
The Last dark step: A fatal attraction has a ‘kept’ man unable to get out of a relationship with a disturbed girlfriend and marry a respectable girl. He is willing to do anything to get away, but she is willing to do anything to keep him. “Flight to the East”: When two strangers on a plane to Cairo meet, coincidence becomes too close for comfort for a man wrongly accused.
results.title_for_label: The Last dark step; Flight to the East

results.title: No pain. The Long shot
results.creator_credit: Alfred J Hitchcock Productions and Shamley Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Alfred Hitchcock presents”.
Two episodes of this fine series on one tape. “No pain”: A paralysed millionaire living in a respirator has a beautiful, young wife. Her straying nature tempts her to pull the plug… will she won’t she? Stars Brian Keith. “The Long shot”: A compulsive gambler, broke and in debt has a loan shark after him, when he fortunately finds a job advertisement for a driver. Seeing it as the perfect way to get out of town he poses as a Londoner, to convince his prospective employer that he is the man for the job. During the journey, he sees that his employer has a bag full of money… what will he be tempted to do? Stars Peter Lawford.

results.title: I spy. Total loss
results.creator_credit: Alfred J Hitchcock Productions and Shamley International Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Alfred Hitchcock presents”.
Two more fine tales from the vault of the master of the macabre. “I spy”: Pompous old Captain Morgan’s wife has up and left him, without so much as a note to let him know where she is. So he has hired private detective, Mr. Fruit to spy on her and see what she’s up to. Mr. Fruit poses as a waiter at the restaurant where she works and waits to see if she has found a gentleman friend… “Total loss”: A widow is left with a clothing business, but her head for business is no match for her sense of style. She is in debt and beginning to get desperate when she is tempted by an insurance scam…
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alfred J Hitchcock Productions and Shamley International Productions

results.title: Tonia Todman's craft room
results.brief_description: Tonia Todman hosts this interesting series of videos about various craft ideas that can be done quickly and easily at home.

group_works.title: Stencilling

results.title: Paper making
results.creator_credit: John Dobis, Sheridan Stumm and Discovery Video
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tonia Todman’s craft room”.
Tonia Todman demonstrates how to make paper. She describes how to create interesting effects through the addition of grasses, seeds, flowers, and threads to your paper pulp. How to emboss or add a watermark to your paper is also explained. As well as recycling scrap paper, Tonia demonstrates how to produce paper from leaves and other natural products, and also from rags.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Dobis, Sheridan Stumm and Discovery Video

group_siblings.title: Stencilling
group_siblings.creator_credit: John Dobis, Sheridan Stumm and Discovery Video

results.title: Stencilling
results.creator_credit: John Dobis, Sheridan Stumm and Discovery Video
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tonia Todman’s craft room”.
Stencilling, a craft that started thousands of years ago with primitive cave painting has become increasingly popular in recent years. It is a very adaptable and creative way for the home decorator to personalise his or her home in a way that is appealing and inexpensive. Tonia Todman tells you all you need to know to be able to enhance your home with charming stencilled designs. Stencils can be applied to your walls, floors, tables, cupboards, beds, boxes, trays, fabrics, the list goes on. Their application can stretch as far as your imagination takes you, to give your home and homeware a unique, picturesque and individual touch. Tonia tells you how to plan and design a stencil, how to transfer designs, how to position and space your stencils for the most effective results, and describes painting techniques and the choice of colour schemes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Dobis, Sheridan Stumm and Discovery Video
